It is important to measure the external diameter of the aorta (outer wall to outer wall) rather than the internal luminal diameter, which may underestimate aortic size if there is an intraluminal thrombus within an aneurysm. The normal diameter for the abdominal aorta is less than 3 cm; an aortic diameter of 4.8 cm, as seen in this patient, indicates the presence of an AAA.
